Authors:
Muge Gidis, Phillip Q. Spinks, Ethem Cevik, Yakup Kaska, H.
Bradley Shaffer
Title:
Shallow genetic divergence indicates a Congo-Nile riverine
connection for the softshell turtle Trionyx triunguis
Keywords:
Trionyx triunguis, Congo River, Nile River, Kükürtlü Lake,
Africa, Mediterranean Sea, Cameroon
Abstract:
We sequenced 20 new, field-collected individuals for up to
seven genes to explore the phylogeography and conservation genetics of
the threatened Nile softshell turtle Trionyx triunguis, including the
first known-locality specimen from sub-Saharan Africa. Samples from
Cameroon (West Africa), the Mediterranean and Nile River differed by at
most ,a single nucleotide per gene, indicating the potential for a
recent connection between these currently disjunct populations via the
Nile-Congo River systems. Recently reported mitochondrial diversity
between Mediterranean and “sub-Saharan” samples of the Nile softshell
indicate significant divergence across the species range, but cannot be
fully incorporated into our analysis since these samples lack specific
locality data.
